The timing of the Supreme Court vacancy: It is confirmed that a vacancy did occur just 27 days before the 1864 election, when Chief Justice Robert B. Taney died on October 12.
Lincoln: s nomination delay: It is true that Lincoln did not make a nomination until after he was reelected, nominating Salmon Chase for chief justice in December 1864.
Lack of evidence for Lincoln: s quote: There is no record or evidence of Lincoln making the specific quote attributed to him by Kamala Harris regarding it not being the right thing to do to fill a Supreme Court vacancy before an election.
Unclear motivation for Lincoln: s delay: Historians state that Lincoln never explained the delay in his own words, leaving his exact rationale for waiting to nominate Chase until after the election unclear.
